types.name: AccountCreationMarketingPreferences
types.description: From the uuid parameter from the email unsubscribe link

enumValues.name: RECEIVES_MARKETING_MATERIAL
enumValues.description: Returned when the email address has signed up for newsletters but has no customer

enumValues.name: DOES_NOT_RECEIVE_MARKETING_MATERIAL
enumValues.description: Returned when the email address has no customer and is not signed up for newsletters

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_ALREADY_EXISTS
enumValues.description: Returned if a customer already exists for this email address

types.name: AccountLinkingExtensionToken
types.description:
A string which authorises the target customer account to be linked to the origin customer account.

An AccountLinkingExtensionToken can be retrieved on the target customer's site by using the origin customer's
AccountLinkingToken in the getAccountExtensionToken mutation.

To use an AccountLinkingExtensionToken to link two accounts, the token should first be transferred back to the site
of the origin customer account, and then submitted to the linkAccounts mutation.

types.name: AccountLinkingToken
types.description:
A string which authorises the origin customer account to be used to start the account linking process.

An AccountLinkingToken should be retrieved via the getAccountLinkingToken mutation as the first step in
linking two accounts.

This token should then be sent to the site of the other account to be linked, which should submit it to the
getAccountExtensionToken mutation.

fields.name: addressLine1
fields.description: House number / House Name / Apartment Number / Floor / Suite number

fields.name: addressLine2
fields.description: Street

fields.name: addressLine4
fields.description: City

fields.name: addressLine5
fields.description: Region / County

fields.name: state
fields.description: Mutually exclusive with addressLine5

inputFields.name: addressLine1
inputFields.description: House number / House Name / Apartment Number / Floor / Suite number

inputFields.name: addressLine2
inputFields.description: Street

inputFields.name: addressLine4
inputFields.description: City

inputFields.name: addressLine5
inputFields.description: Region / County

inputFields.name: state
inputFields.description: Mutually exclusive with addressLine5

inputFields.name: postalCode
inputFields.description: Post Code / Zip Code

types.name: AlternateLink
types.description:
URLs to alternative locale versions of the current page or product.

These should be added to the page in <link rel="alternate" hreflang="$locale" href="$url"> tags to
provide hints for SEO purposes.

fields.name: optionKey
fields.description:
This is an option to a question, an optionKey will always be provided and a translation may sometimes be provided.
If a translation is not provided, you should use the optionKey to present a translated value to the customer.

fields.name: totalBasketDiscount
fields.description: May be null if the discount amount should not be shown

fields.name: removeable
fields.description: Some offers automatically apply so cannot be removed

types.name: AttachmentUploaderConfig
types.description:
To upload an attachment:

1) Query for the customer's Attachment Uploader using the attachmentUploaderConfig query.
2) POST the file to the upload URL of the sites domain with the authToken in the "uploadToken" form field
   and the attachment in the "attachment" form field as "Content type: application/octet-stream"
3) Get the "token" from the response and submit that as part of your mutation input as attachmentToken

enumValues.name: FAILED_LOGIN
enumValues.description: On login, either the user's email was not found, or their password was incorrect

enumValues.name: ACCOUNT_LOCKED
enumValues.description: The user's account is locked, and can be unlocked by resetting their password with the forgottenPassword mutation

enumValues.name: SOCIAL_LINK_PENDING
enumValues.description:
On Social Login, the link between the account on the social authentication provider and the customer was unable to
be verified.  It can be verified via email.  A social link verification email can be sent with the
requestSocialLinkVerificationEmail mutation

enumValues.name: INVALID_DATA
enumValues.description: The data provided on registration or social login was invalid, or insufficient to create an account.

enumValues.name: INVALID_PASSWORD
enumValues.description: The password provided on registration did not meet the password complexity requirements

enumValues.name: ACCOUNT_EXISTS
enumValues.description: On registration, an account with the given email address already exists

enumValues.name: EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SENT
enumValues.description:
On registration, there was already an account, but the account did not have a password set up.

We sent the user a verification email which will allow them to set a password on their existing account.

This will happen if registration occurs over a social login or guest checkout account.

types.name: AuthenticationResponse
types.description:
Returned on any field intended to log the user in.

For Web clients, just receiving a successful AuthenticationResponse is enough to be logged in, as
the HTTP response will come with an authentication cookie.

For API clients, the token field should be extracted on a successful login and used
as the Authorization header for future API requests, in the following format:

Authorization: Opaque <token>

types.name: Base64Bytes
types.description: Binary data, base64-encoded to allow easy transport as a JSON string.

fields.name: standardPrice
fields.description: The total price before applying any discounts.

fields.name: chargePrice
fields.description: The total price after applying any discounts.

fields.name: merged
fields.description:
Have the contents of the current customer's saved basket been merged into this basket.
If this flag is true, then checkout will be blocked.
Clear by setting the "acknowledgeMerge" flag on the basket query.

fields.name: code
fields.description: This object will be null if no code is on the basket.

fields.name: offer
fields.description: May be null if the offer triggered by the code is not valid anymore but the code is yet to be removed

fields.name: chargePrice
fields.description: The price after applying any discounts.  Will be 0 for free gifts

fields.name: standardPricePerUnit
fields.description: The price per unit before applying any discounts.

fields.name: chargePricePerUnit
fields.description: The price per unit after applying any discounts.  Will be 0 for free gifts

fields.name: totalStandardPrice
fields.description: The price before applying any discounts.

fields.name: totalChargePrice
fields.description: The price after applying any discounts.  Will be 0 for free gifts

fields.name: freeGift
fields.description: If the product has been added as a free gift by an offer

types.name: BasketMessage
types.description: Messages to show at the top of the basket

enumValues.name: CODE_INVALID
enumValues.description: Display as an error.  The code the user applied with an `applyCodeToBasket` mutation is invalid.

enumValues.name: CODE_EXPIRED
enumValues.description: Display as an error.  The code the user applied with an `applyCodeToBasket` mutation is valid, but has expired.

enumValues.name: PROMO_CODE_ALREADY_USED
enumValues.description: Display as an error.  The code the user applied with an `applyCodeToBasket` mutation is a promotion code that has already been used.

enumValues.name: CODE_VALID_BUT_NOT_APPLICABLE_TO_BASKET
enumValues.description: Display as an error.  The code the user applied with an `applyCodeToBasket` mutation is valid, but not applicable to their basket.

enumValues.name: REFERRER_NOT_ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: Display as an error.  The referral code is valid, but the account is already referred or is not a new account

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_OUT_OF_STOCK
enumValues.description: Display as an error.  One or more products (detailed in the message) are currently out of stock.

enumValues.name: UPSELL
enumValues.description: Display as info.  The user can add additional products to their basket to receive a discount.

enumValues.name: BETTER_OFFER_ALREADY_APPLIED
enumValues.description:
Display as info.  The code the user applied with an `applyCodeToBasket` mutation was valid, but cancels out an
existing, higher value offer. Note: This does not prevent a user overriding their current code with a lower value code

enumValues.name: CODE_APPLIED
enumValues.description: Display as success.  The code the user applied with an `applyCodeToBasket` mutation was valid

enumValues.name: OFFER_APPLIED
enumValues.description: Display as success.  An offer has been applied to the basket

enumValues.name: SELECT_YOUR_SAMPLE_APPLIED
enumValues.description: Display as success.  The user became eligible for a free gift selection

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: Not all brands have an associated logo

types.name: Breadcrumb
types.description:
Breadcrumbs are links to other pages that appear at the top of a page, providing a way for customers
to get back to a "parent" page, for example from the "Protein" page to the general "Nutrition" page.

fields.name: siteKey
fields.description:
Any **public** configuration information for this captcha type.
Not required for mobile app mechanisms.

enumValues.name: INVALID_PAYMENT_OPTION
enumValues.description: Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: INVALID_SHIPPING_DESTINATION
enumValues.description: Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: INVALID_CURRENCY
enumValues.description: Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: INVALID_BASKET
enumValues.description: Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: INVALID_BASKET_NO_ITEM_ON_BASKET
enumValues.description: Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: INVALID_BASKET_MAX_QUANTITY_EXCEEDED
enumValues.description: Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: INVALID_BASKET_SUBSCRIPTIONS_ON_GUEST_CHECKOUT
enumValues.description: Only occurs on guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: BASKETS_MERGED
enumValues.description:
The customer's baskets were merged when attempting to start checkout.
They should be shown the basket again and asked to confirm.

Occurs on both checkoutStart and guestCheckoutStart

enumValues.name: NOT_ELIGIBLE_FOR_REFERRAL
enumValues.description: Only occurs on checkoutStart

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_LOGGED_IN
enumValues.description: Only occurs on guestCheckoutStart

types.name: Colour
types.description: Hex colour (e.g. "#000000")

types.name: Country
types.description: As described here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2

enumValues.name: AN
enumValues.description:
[Netherlands Antilles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_Antilles). No longer legally
exists but still used as a shipping country within our system.

fields.name: values
fields.description: An ordered list of values to use as the cells for this table row

fields.name: balance
fields.description:
The total credit for this account for this currency, including credit shared from linked accounts.
Always in the currency of the credit account.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amounts are always in the currency of the credit account.

fields.name: amountUsed
fields.description: Will always be between 0 and `amount`, will be 0 for Reservations and Paid Out Actions.

fields.name: amountAvailable
fields.description: Will always be `amount` minus `amountUsed`.

fields.name: socialLinks
fields.description:
All social links for the customer with the given status.

If status is null or not supplied, all social links are returned

fields.name: discussions
fields.description:
Returns all discussions for this customer.
If status is provided, the result will be filtered to just discussions with the given status.

types.name: Date
types.description: A date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (In London Time)

types.name: DeliveryInfoGroup
types.description: Represents a single grouping of shipping destinations, for example "Europe", "North America" or "Rest Of The World"

fields.name: headers
fields.description: An ordered list of keys representing the headers of the table columns

fields.name: countryDetails
fields.description: Unordered list of countries.  You may wish to sort this alphabetically by the country's translated name.

types.name: DisplayString
types.description: A string which has already been translated to the sites locale by the API. Can be displayed to the customer without the need for any localisation.

types.name: FacetSelectionInput
types.description: If optionName is non-null, from and to are ignored.

enumValues.name: FIRST_PARTY_AUTH
enumValues.description:
Whether or not the site supports login with passwords to dedicated user accounts on the site.

If this feature is not available, other methods of logging in or proceeding may be available such
as social login or guest checkout

enumValues.name: ORDER_RETURNS
enumValues.description: Whether or not the site supports returns

types.name: FileDownload
types.description:
A downloadable file, which can be saved or displayed on the client.
This is needed primarily for workflows (e.g. returns) that include programatically-created PDF files.

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description:
The [MIME type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)
(as used in `Content-Type` headers) for this file. e.g. `application/pdf` or `text/plain`.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The contents of this file, base64 encoded.

types.name: Flag
types.description:
Flags are available as part of the extensions for every request.

On each GraphQL request, the extensions will contain a list of all flags that apply.

Each flag will appear at most once.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: error
fields.description: Check to make sure error is not set to confirm success

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Used as an identifier and for translations.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of form (see the enum for descriptions)

fields.name: displayStyle
fields.description: How the form should be displayed once you have started it.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: An ordered list of fields to be included with the form

fields.name: submission
fields.description: Get a single submission by ID

fields.name: submissions
fields.description: A list of all submissions to this form.

fields.name: isMultiSubmission
fields.description: Can this form be submitted multiple times?

fields.name: canSubmit
fields.description: Can this form be sumitted (again)?

fields.name: question
fields.description: Use to get the "name" of the Field, to pre-populate the values.

fields.name: values
fields.description: For single-select or free text answers, a singleton list will be returned.

fields.name: locked
fields.description: Sometimes a question is locked and cannot be edited

inputFields.name: values
inputFields.description: For single-select or free text answers, only a singleton list will be accepted

fields.name: required
fields.description: If required is true, the field will be rejected if the value is empty or null

fields.name: confirmable
fields.description:
If confirmable is true, the field should be rendered with an additional confirmation field, where the user must
re-enter the value.  Validation of this should be done on the frontend and this does not affect the data that should
be sent to the GraphQL API.

fields.name: disabled
fields.description:
Can this field be edited? If true, then this field should still be shown on the form with the standard logic to
determine its initial value, but the entry should not be changed. If this field is submitted with the rest of the
form to the API (optional) then its value will be ignored

fields.name: options
fields.description: If answerOptions is non-null, the field will be rejected if the value is not one of the values provided, or null.

fields.name: renderConditions
fields.description:
A list of requirements, all of which must be met in order for this field to be displayed.
If the field is not displayed, then it should not be incliuded when the form is submitted to the API.
These requirement will be dynamic to the form will become visible or hidden as the answers to other questions change.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description:
The default value of this field.  May be ignored, for example if there's an existing value from
a submission being edited.

enumValues.name: BOOLEAN
enumValues.description: E.g. a checkbox.

enumValues.name: GROUP
enumValues.description: E.g. radio buttons.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: E.g. a drop down list.

fields.name: validators
fields.description: The list of validators which rejected this field.  A subset of the validators returned in the form

fields.name: requiredButNotProvided
fields.description: true if this field was marked as required, but the provided value was empty or null

fields.name: invalidOption
fields.description: true if this field has a strict set of options (LIST / GROUP) but the value provided was not one of them

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: You may filter by either Form Type or Identifier (or neither).

inputFields.name: submissionId
inputFields.description: The submission being edited, null if this is a new submission.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: Success, Form was submitted and is complete.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED_INCOMPLETE
enumValues.description: Success, Form was submitted, but was not completed, questions missing.

enumValues.name: EDITED_STILL_COMPLETE
enumValues.description: Success, Form was edited, and it is still complete.

enumValues.name: EDITED_NOW_COMPLETE
enumValues.description: Success, Form was edited, and this submission completed the form.

enumValues.name: EDITED_INCOMPLETE
enumValues.description: Success, Form was edited, but the form is still incomplete.

enumValues.name: CANT_BE_SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: This form is locked, or otherwise unavailable, don't offer a retry.

enumValues.name: ERROR_SUBMITTING
enumValues.description: There was invalid data in this submission, fix the error and retry.

enumValues.name: ACCOUNT_CREATION
enumValues.description: Forms for use within Account Creation

enumValues.name: MAIN_PROFILE
enumValues.description: Main Profiles should be displayed prominently on the Account Home page

enumValues.name: ADDITIONAL_PROFILE
enumValues.description: Additional Profiles will be shown on another page within the Account Section

enumValues.name: CUSTOM_MARKETING_PREFERENCES
enumValues.description: Profiles that hold custom marketing preferences information

enumValues.name: PROFESSIONAL_ACCOUNTS
enumValues.description: Professional accounts application form as a profile

enumValues.name: TRADE_ACCOUNTS
enumValues.description: Trade accounts application form as a profile

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_RECOMMENDER
enumValues.description: Product recommendation as a profile

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_REVIEW
enumValues.description: Forms for product reviews

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Locale
types.description: Language and country e.g. en_GB

inputFields.name: messageShown
inputFields.description: The message shown to the user for marketing consent, either as plaintext, or HTML.

inputFields.name: formIdentifier
inputFields.description: An identifier of the form being submitted

inputFields.name: formLocation
inputFields.description: A string that identifies where on site the opt-in was displayed, such as a URL

types.name: MarketingToken
types.description:
A token included in email links to verify that actions are performed by the intended user only
and to identify the user without having to pass through emails as parameters

types.name: Money
types.description:
This scalar represents a price or other unit of money.

It is serialized as a string of the format `GBP8.85`.

The first 3 characters are a currency code, and the rest is a decimal number representing the number of
units of the given currency.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: A string containing a decimal number, to avoid rounding and precision issues

fields.name: displayValue
fields.description: A fully formatted string for displaying this amount of money in HTML. e.g "£76.49"

types.name: Month
types.description: 2-digit integer e.g. January is 01

fields.name: deleteAddress
fields.description:
Deletes the address with the given ID if it exists.
Requires Authentication.

fields.name: addAddress
fields.description:
Adds a new address based on the given input.
Requires Authentication.

fields.name: replaceAddress
fields.description:
Deletes the address with the given ID if it exists.
And adds a new address based on the given input and returns the ID of the new address.
This does not update the address with the given ID.
Requires Authentication.

fields.name: updateAccountSettings
fields.description: See the Form from the `accountSettingsForm` query

fields.name: cancelOrder
fields.description: Cancels an entire order, if it is cancellable.

fields.name: cancelOrderProducts
fields.description: Partially cancels an order. Cannot be used to cancel OrderProducts which are in a special offer group.

fields.name: cancelOrderSpecialOfferGroups
fields.description: Partially cancels an order, cancelling entire special offer groups.

fields.name: forgottenPassword
fields.description:
Causes a PasswordResetToken to be sent to the user's email address, if an account exists with the given username.

The PasswordResetToken from the email can be used with the resetPassword mutation.

fields.name: requestSetPasswordEmail
fields.description:
Causes a PasswordResetToken to be sent to the user's email address.  The email's wording is different, as this is
intended to be used for accounts which do not already have a password (such as Wechat social accounts)

The PasswordResetToken from the email can be used with the resetPassword mutation.

fields.name: register
fields.description:
Registration forms can be dynamic. To get the exact fields and options required to register for a site, query the forms API with
the identifier ACCOUNT_CREATION. If this doesn't exist, the fields are static and visible in the RegistrationInput type.

fields.name: socialLogin
fields.description:
Attempts to log you into the website using the SocialAuthenticationToken returned from Social Login Service
or the token returned from a previous attempt to log in.

socialAuthenticationToken and missingInformation should be considered deprecated andwill be removed in due course.
Please only submit the SocialLoginInput object

fields.name: requestSocialLinkVerificationEmail
fields.description: The following endpoints handle the approving of a link between a Social User and a Customer on this site.

fields.name: signUpForMarketing
fields.description: Sign up for email or SMS marketing without the requirement to be logged in

fields.name: addProductToBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: addProductsToBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: removeProductFromBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: updateProductQuantityInBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: supersizeProductInBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.
Provide the item id of the product to be supersized (must be supersizable) and it will be added to the basket and the current product removed.

fields.name: applyCodeToBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: removeCodeFromBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: addSelectYourSampleProductToBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: removeSelectYourSampleProductFromBasket
fields.description:
If a null basketId is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: replyToDiscussion
fields.description:
Requires authentication
Returns the id of the newly created message

fields.name: markDiscussionMessagesAsRead
fields.description:
Requires authentication
If there are newer messages than the provided message ID, the discussion stays unread, preventing an unseen
message from being unknowingly marked as read

fields.name: createDiscussion
fields.description:
Requires authentication
Returns the id of the newly created messaged
New discussions

fields.name: type
fields.description: Null if only a heading

enumValues.name: TEXT
enumValues.description:
Depending on platform and level, render as either a simple text link, a list of links containing
its children, a top-level button which causes its children to appear below when hovered over, or
a button which causes the children to open over the current nav as a new panel when tapped.

For examples of each of these states, see the documentation.

enumValues.name: TEXT_CARD
enumValues.description:
This navigation item can only appear at the top level.  The children of this navigation item
should each be displayed as a box with bold text in it.  On mobile apps, this should render the
same as TEXT.

For an example, see the documentation.

enumValues.name: THUMBNAIL_CARD
enumValues.description:
This navigation item can only appear at the top level.  The children of this navigation item
should each be displayed as a box with bold text in it, with an image to the left, if one is
provided.  If no image is provided, this should render the same as TEXT_CARD.

For an example, see the documentation.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_CARD
enumValues.description:
This navigation item can only appear at the top level.  The children of this navigation item
should each be displayed as a box with a large central image, with bold text below it.

For an example, see the documentation

enumValues.name: BRANDS
enumValues.description:
This navigation item can only appear at the top level.  This navigation item can have no
children.  When hovered over in the top-level nav,  this item should cause a new menu to
appear below it.  This menu contains a brand selector.  This contains a list of brands in
alphabetical order, each acting as a link to the brand's landing page.  At the top of the menu
should be buttons for each letter of the alphabet, with the menu only showing brands that begin
with the selected letter.

The brands can be accessed via the `brands` query.

For an example, see the documentation

enumValues.name: FEATURED
enumValues.description:
This navigation item can only appear at the second level.  This type is used where a separate
section of the navigation tree breaks off from an existing TEXT tree.  This navigation item
appears to the left of all of the other sibling items.  This item is rendered as a list of its
children, with no header.

For an example, see the documentation

enumValues.name: DETACHED
enumValues.description:
This navigation item can only appear at the second level, and only on the alternative navigation
display.  The detached navigation type is used where a separate section of the navigation tree
breaks off from the core tree at the second level, appearing to the right of its sibling items,
creating its own navigation tree.

For an example, see the documentation

enumValues.name: WATERFALL
enumValues.description:
This navigation item signifies that at least one of the children of this item will be of type DETACHED.
This allows the client to render a different view without needing to traverse all children of a top
level item to check for a child of type DETACHED to know whether to render a special view that
supports the detached sections.

For an example, see the documentation

types.name: OptionChoice
types.description: A single choice for a single option, such as "Chocolate" for the "Flavour" option.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: This is when the order is created and the payment taken

fields.name: dispatchedAt
fields.description: If the order has been dispatched, this is the dispatched time

fields.name: discussions
fields.description:
Returns a paginated list of discussions associated with this order.

Equivalent to querying Customer.discussions with an order number filter

fields.name: isReturnable
fields.description: TODO: Need to discuss how this should work for guest orders

fields.name: sku
fields.description: If the product is no longer visible, sku will be non-null while product is null

fields.name: quantity
fields.description:
The total requested quantity of this product in the order.

This is unaffected by the status of the individual items (such as cancellation or refunds)

fields.name: dispatchDate
fields.description: For order products which are not yet dispatched, this is the estimated date

fields.name: specialOfferGroup
fields.description:
Products that are in a special offer group can only be cancelled as part of that group, and should be displayed
together in the cancellation UI

fields.name: namedDeliveryDate
fields.description: The named-day delivery date as entered on checkout

enumValues.name: OUTSTANDING
enumValues.description: The order has not reached a terminal state, i.e. processing, payment problem etc.

enumValues.name: DISPATCHED
enumValues.description: The order has been dispatched (currently the final state). Can be used to show all successful orders that are completed.

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: The order has reached a terminal state, i.e. it has been dispatched or cancelled.

types.name: PagePath
types.description:
The path to a page (Not including extensions)

(e.g. "/dietary-needs/vegan")

types.name: PasswordResetToken
types.description:
A string which authorises a password reset for a specific customer account.

When the forgottenPassword mutation is called, a PasswordResetToken will be sent to the customer's email address.

This PasswordResetToken can be used in the resetPassword mutation to reset the user's password.

fields.name: url
fields.description: In the format '/sports-nutrition/impact-whey-protein/10530943.html'

fields.name: inWishlist
fields.description:
True if the wishlist contains this product with no selected variant,
if a variant is selected, the inWishlist flag on the variant will be true instead.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: (e.g. "DVD" or "Blu-Ray")

fields.name: sizeGuide
fields.description: As a dynamic content

fields.name: marketedSpecialOffer
fields.description: A marketed special offer to display on search results and product lists.

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: 70x70 Pixel Image

fields.name: largeProduct
fields.description: 300x300 Pixel Image

fields.name: zoom
fields.description: 960x960 Pixel Image

fields.name: original
fields.description: Unaltered version of image uploaded to our system

fields.name: correctedQuery
fields.description:
If this is non-null, 0 results were found, but results were found for a similar query,
which was returned instead.

fields.name: freeGiftProduct
fields.description: This will only be non-null when the best special offer for this product is a free gift offer

enumValues.name: SIMILAR_PRODUCTS
enumValues.description:
This returns products of a similar category that are in stock. This is used on THG sites
to suggest other products to a customer when the product they are viewing is out of stock.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_EVENTUALLY_BOUGHT
enumValues.description:
This looks at what products other customers added to their basket when browsing the product(s)
currently being viewed. If the probability of adding a particular product to basket is high
then that's what will be recommended.

fields.name: newReviewForm
fields.deprecationReason: Field still valid. SKU no longer required as input as the SKU of the product this is attached to will be used

fields.name: value
fields.description: E.g. "5" in 5 kg or "35" in 35 servings

fields.name: unit
fields.description: E.g. "kg" in 5 kg or "servings" in 35 servings

fields.name: product
fields.description:
The main product which includes this variant.
May not necessarily be the product under which this was queried.

fields.name: marketedSpecialOffer
fields.description: A marketed special offer to display on product pages.

fields.name: product
fields.description:
If strict is false, the api is allowed to perform redirects, such as returning a master product when given the SKU
of one of its variants.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: Returns the current customer if the customer is logged in, or null otherwise

fields.name: componentWidgets
fields.description:
Widgets are usually associated with pages on site, but there is sometimes the need to display widgets across other components such as a popup, or alongside core e-commerce objects like the basket.

These "special" sets of widgets can be queried through the componentWidgets query and the supported components can be found using the supportedComponentWidgetNames query.

fields.name: passwordResetTokenValidity
fields.description: Returns information about a password reset token without consuming it.

fields.name: exchangeSocialAuthenticationToken
fields.description:
This is a query despite having side effects so it can be queried on the server-side at the same time as querying
other information to deliver the first page load

token should be considered deprecated and will be removed in due course.
Please only submit the SocialLoginInput object

fields.name: siteProperties
fields.description:
Returns all site properties for the site.

If propertyBucket is provided, that bucket will be used to retrieve properties.  Otherwise, it will default to
"frontend".

Providing a preview ID allows property changes to be previewed before committing them.  The preview ID
should come from the Properties-Preview header.

fields.name: basket
fields.description:
If a null id is provided, this will fall back to the logged in customer's saved basket, or a new basket.
This may return a different basket ID than provided, if the basket moved, merged, or didn't exist.

fields.name: from
fields.description: May be null if the range is unbounded (e.g. "Up to 5")

fields.name: to
fields.description: May be null if the range is unbounded (e.g. "50 and up")

types.name: RatingReviewElement
types.description: Represents a rating (for example out of 5 stars)

types.name: RegistrationInput
types.description: Any additions to this should also be added to SocialLoginMissingInformation and maybe to the customer object

fields.name: referenceFieldName
fields.description:
This condition is a requirement for a field to be rendered, eg: card_details may have a condition:
referenceFieldName: "age"
relationship: "GREATER_THAN"
value: "18"

fields.name: error
fields.description: Check to make sure error is not set to confirm success

types.name: RequestSocialLinkVerificationEmailResponse
types.description: The response will either contain the error field or the socialAuthenticationToken field

fields.name: socialAuthenticationToken
fields.description: A new token that can be used to resend the email

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The provided address is not valid

enumValues.name: VALUE_TOO_HIGH
enumValues.description: The value of the selected products is too high

enumValues.name: ORDER_PRODUCTS_INVALID
enumValues.description: The selected products are invalid for return

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
enumValues.description: Unrecognised error found

enumValues.name: ORDER_PRODUCT_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The product is not available for return

enumValues.name: ITEM_NOT_DISPATCHED
enumValues.description: The product has not been dispatched yet

enumValues.name: ITEM_DELIVERY_DATE_UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The product's delivery date is unknown

enumValues.name: ITEM_EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The product's return date has expired

enumValues.name: DROPSHIP_ORDER_PRODUCT
enumValues.description: The product is a dropship

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_TYPE_INVALID
enumValues.description: The product type is not valid

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_NOT_IN_ORDER
enumValues.description: The product is not in the order

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
enumValues.description: Unrecognised error found

types.name: SKU
types.description: Numeric product ID

types.name: SelectYourSample
types.description: One of our offer types allows the customer to select a gift at the basket. These can also be tiered to allow for multiple gifts at different thresholds.

fields.name: currentAmountSpent
fields.description: Total amount currently spent on products meeting the requirements for this Select Your Sample

fields.name: additionalSpendToReach
fields.description:
The amount of additional money the customer must spend on qualifying products to reach this
tier, or null if the tier is already reached.

types.name: SessionSettings
types.description: Currency and Shipping Destination are passed in as this can affect the price of products after offer evaluation

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: If the value is passed as null, it means it existed before and needs deleting.

inputFields.name: campaignId
inputFields.description: The ID of the marketing campaign being signed up to. Currently must be an Integer

inputFields.name: contactDetails
inputFields.description: Interpreted as a phone number or email address depending on the provided MarketingType

fields.name: properties
fields.description:
If keys is provided, the result will be limited to only the given property keys,
otherwise, all properties will be returned

types.name: SocialAsset
types.description:
This will be used on generated widgets with a UGC-type parameter.

The field will look as follows:

userGeneratedContent(offset: Int! = 0, limit: Int! = 5): SocialAssets

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: Full Name may or may not be provided based on the social network

fields.name: form
fields.description:
In the case that the social login failed due to an INVALID_DATA error, the 'form' field will be non-null,
and will contain a form containing only the missing or invalid fields required.

fields.name: socialLoginToken
fields.description:
In the case that the social login failed, the 'socialLoginToken' field will be non-null, and will contain
a token which can be used in the socialLogin mutation to retry social login with additional or different data

fields.name: optInForm
fields.description:
In the case that only Marketing Opt-In is required for Account Creation, when a social login is attempted
then the Account will be created successfully and this object will be non-null.
In which case you should render an opt-in page and submit the result with the updateMarketingPreferences mutation

types.name: SocialAuthenticationToken
types.description:
A string which represents a partially completed Social Login.

It can be submitted to the exchangeSocialLoginToken query or socialLogin mutation to continue socially logging in.

In the case that a social login fails, a new SocialAuthenticationToken will be returned which can be used
to continue the social login process with additional data

types.name: SocialLinkID
types.description: A string which represents a link between a single account on a social login provider

inputFields.name: optInAfterAccountCreation
inputFields.description: Should we offer opt-in before or after Account Creation

types.name: SocialLoginMissingInformation
types.description:
All input fields for social login are optional.  Which ones are actually needed depends on the information provided
by the social provider.

The required fields can be determined using the Form from the SocialAuthenticationResponse type.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A unique identifier for this social provider.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The text to display on the social login button, if applicable

fields.name: loginUrl
fields.description:
A URL for the social login button to link to.  This URL comes with some already existing parameters,
but must be updated to add the following query parameters:

clientState:  A string which will be returned once the user returns from the social login provider.  This can be
  used to store information that needs to be remembered from the start of their journey when they return, such as
  a CSRF token.

returnUrl: A full URL (Including protocol) which the user will return to when they return from the social login
  provider (e.g. https://www.mydomain.com/socialLogin)

The user will return from the social provider via a POST request to the returnUrl.  Their request body will be
form encoded, and contain the following data:

token: A SocialAuthenticationToken, which can be used in this API via the exchangeSocialAuthenticationToken and
socialLogin fields.

clientState: The same client state provided as a parameter to the URL.

types.name: State
types.description:
[ISO_3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) state code.
The non-standard codes `US_AA`, `US_AE` and `US_AP` represent Armed Forces locations, similar to BFPO.
Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands etc. are not listed here as we treat them as separate countries.

enumValues.name: US_AA
enumValues.description: Armed Forces Americas

enumValues.name: US_AE
enumValues.description: Armed Forces Europe

enumValues.name: US_AP
enumValues.description: Armed Forces Pacific

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: nextSupersizeOption
fields.description: E.g. next supersize option is 10 kg

fields.name: savingUnit
fields.description: The unit for the saving, e.g. "1 kg" in saving 2 per 1 kg

fields.name: savingPerUnit
fields.description: Saving for per unit, e.g. "2" per 1 kg or per 20 servings

types.name: Timestamp
types.description: Milliseconds elapsed since the unix epoch

inputFields.name: token
inputFields.description: This is the uuid parameter in the standard unsubscribe link

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: This is actually a hash of the email address but is in the unsubscribe link as the email parameter

types.name: URL
types.description: May be absolute or relative

inputFields.name: newDateOfBirth
inputFields.description: New date of birth. Set to null to remove from account.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_DATA
enumValues.description:
There was insufficient data to update this marketing preference, such as
attempting to sign up for SMS marketing when the customer has no phone number.

inputFields.name: newNumber
inputFields.description: New phone number. Set to null to remove from account.

enumValues.name: NOT_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description:
The argument is a comma-separated list of field names.  The field value should be rejected if it is equal to the
value of any of the fields specified.

enumValues.name: MIN_LENGTH
enumValues.description: The argument is an integer.  The field value should be rejected if its length is less than the argument.

enumValues.name: MAX_LENGTH
enumValues.description: The argument is an integer.  The field value should be rejected if its length is greater than the argument.

enumValues.name: MIN_VALUE
enumValues.description: The argument is comparable with the expected input in the context of the field type.  The field value will be rejected if it is less than the argument.

enumValues.name: MAX_VALUE
enumValues.description: The argument is comparable with the expected input in the context of the field type.  The field value will be rejected if it is greater than the argument.

enumValues.name: MIN_DAYS_OLD
enumValues.description: The argument is comparable with the expected date input in the context of the field type.  The date field value will be rejected if it is newer than the date calculated with the argument.

enumValues.name: MAX_DAYS_OLD
enumValues.description: The argument is comparable with the expected date input in the context of the field type.  The date field value will be rejected if it is older than the date calculated with the argument.

enumValues.name: MIN_OPTIONS
enumValues.description:
The argument is an integer.  The field values will be rejected if there are fewer options selected than are allowed here.
This validator is mainly for use with multiselect and likert scale fields

enumValues.name: MAX_OPTIONS
enumValues.description:
The argument is an integer.  The field values will be rejected if there are more options selected than are allowed here.
This validator is mainly for use with multiselect and likert scale fields

enumValues.name: NO_DIGITS
enumValues.description: The field value should be rejected if it contains any digits (0-9)

enumValues.name: NO_SPECIAL_CHARACTERS
enumValues.description: The field value should be rejected if it contains any of the following special characters: (?, \, ;, :. <, >, ", %, $)

enumValues.name: REGEX_MATCHES
enumValues.description: The argument is a string containing a Regex.  The field value should be rejected if it does not match the given regex.

enumValues.name: REGEX_DOES_NOT_MATCH
enumValues.description: The argument is a string containing a Regex.  The field value should be rejected if it matches the given regex.

enumValues.name: MIN_UPPERCASE
enumValues.description:
The argument is an integer.  The field value should be rejected the number of uppercase letters is less than the
argument.

enumValues.name: MIN_LOWERCASE
enumValues.description:
The argument is an integer.  The field value should be rejected the number of lowercase letters is less than the
argument.

enumValues.name: MIN_NUMBERS
enumValues.description: The argument is an integer.  The field value should be rejected the number of digits is less than the argument.

enumValues.name: MIN_SPECIAL_CHARACTERS
enumValues.description:
The argument is an integer.  The field value should be rejected the number of special characters is less than the
argument.

enumValues.name: SPECIFIED_ANSWERS_ONLY
enumValues.description:
The argument is not required.  The field value should be rejected if the value is not one of the provided options.
This will almost always be set when there is an options list provided.

enumValues.name: SERVER_SIDE_CHECK
enumValues.description: Signals that this argument may be rejected by the backend for any reason.

enumValues.name: MUST_BE_UNIQUE
enumValues.description:
For example, the email field might have the MUST_BE_UNIQUE validator, as the user must input an email that does not
match any existing customer's email address

enumValues.name: EMAIL_DOMAIN
enumValues.description: The argument is an email domain. The field value should be accepted if it follows the format {any prefix}@{given domain}

types.name: VariantOption
types.description:
An axis on which a product can vary, such as colour or flavour.
A Product may have 0 or more options.

types.name: Void
types.description: Always null

types.name: WishlistItem
types.description:
There may be multiple wishlist items for the same product,
but none with the same product and selected variant

types.name: Year
types.description: 4-digit integer e.g. 2019

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: rateLimited
directives.description:
Any fields annotated with the @rateLimited directive may fail due to rate limiting.

In the case of rate limiting, the field will return null, and a GraphQL error will be included in the response.

See the User's Guide for further information.

directives.name: weight
sensitive
directives.description:
Field arguments which contain sensitive information should be annotated with the @sensitive directive.

This will prevent them from being logged along with the query

directives.name: authenticated
directives.description: Fields with @authenticated will fail if the user is not logged in.

directives.name: internal
directives.description: Fields with @internal will fail if the user's request does not originate from a THG network.

directives.name: volatile
directives.description: Definitions with the @volatile directive are experimental and likely to change in the future

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field, argument, input field or enum value as deprecated

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
